Hello World!

23 Apr 2015

Hello friends.

My setup for this website is actually really nice, much better than my usual way of doing things. The actual website uses Jekyll, which is an amazing little static site generator.

Jekyll & Hyde

I came across Alex Bilbie's website while I doing an investigation into OAuth and the look caught my eye. I found out he used Hyde, which is a theme for Jekyll, and decided why not.

Jekyll is essentially a little CMS that can do whatever you want it to. The blog posts are generated from Markdown files in the _posts folder, Hyde's sidebar links are generated from any files that have YAML front matter blocks, and from there you can change things as much or as little as you want.

I changed the theme color to green, changed the font of the title, and now I'm a web designer.

Home is where you make it

I finally decided to try out Vagrant the other day with Laravel Homestead, and it was one of the better choices I've made recently.
